neighbors.name: Steven J. & Francesca Brennan
neighbors.claims: Steven J. Brennan and his wife Francesca are listed as owners of a parcel in Cochise County. Public records indicate they also own residential property in Tucson, Arizona, specifically at Mariposa Woods Place, suggesting they are absentee landowners ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/1632-N-Mariposa-Woods-Pl-309-Tucson-AZ-85749/455799539_zpid/)). No record of local civic engagement or publicly stated views on development in Cochise County could be verified.
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee owners based in Tucson; no local political footprint found

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact them via phone or email, emphasizing how the project could maintain or enhance property values and minimize any impact on their land.

citations.claim: Public records indicate they also own residential property in Tucson, Arizona, specifically at Mariposa Woods Place
citations.title: 1632 N Mariposa Woods Pl, Tucson, AZ 85749

neighbors.name: Lodestar Investments LC
neighbors.claims: Lodestar Investments LC is a limited liability company listed as the owner of parcel 106-15-012T in Cochise County. The entity appears to hold the land for investment purposes, with no identified local operational footprint ([AZCC](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/BusinessSearch/BusinessInfo?entityNumber=23247916)). While a mining company named Lodestar Minerals has operations in Arizona (Virgin Mountain Project), no direct link to this specific LLC in Cochise County could be verified ([Lodestar Minerals](https://www.lodestarminerals.com.au/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Corporate entity with opaque ownership; no known local representative

approach_recommendations.engage: If needed, reach the companyâ€™s representative through formal channels, focusing on business considerations and regulatory compliance.

neighbors.name: Kovan Mountjoy
neighbors.claims: Kovan Mountjoy is the listed contact for ABM Development LLC, a general contracting and real estate development firm based in Huachuca City ([ABM Development](https://www.abmdevelopment.com/contact-us)). The company describes itself as a family-run business that has operated in the area since 1994, specializing in custom home building, excavation, and land clearing ([ABM Development](https://www.abmdevelopment.com/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owner of established local development firm

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a business-oriented approach, acknowledging his role as a local developer. Highlight potential contracting opportunities or how the project aligns with regional economic growth without impeding local real estate values.

A search of local media and planning documents yielded no results linking this individual to public commentary on development issues.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private citizen; no public roles found

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach one-on-one through a neighborly introduction. As a private individual with no public track record, prioritize listening to personal concerns regarding viewshed and construction nuisance.

neighbors.name: Frank Cullen Brophy
neighbors.claims: Frank Cullen Brophy (deceased) acquired the historic Babacomari Ranch in 1935; the property remains under the stewardship of his descendants through a family partnership ([Babacomari Ranch History](https://babacomariranch.com/history)). The family has placed over 2,400 acres under conservation easements to protect grasslands and wetlands ([Arizona Land and Water Trust](https://alwt.org/babacomari-ranch/)). In 2024, the family sought county approval for a guest ranch development on the property to generate revenue and maintain the ranch's integrity ([Patagonia Regional Times](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/county-to-consider-permit-for-new-40-60-million-dude-ranch-in-sonoita/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Historic ranch family; largest private land parcel in AZ

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the family leadership (currently Ben Brophy and others) through a conservation-focused dialogue. Acknowledge their dual goals of land stewardship and economic diversification (as seen in their guest ranch proposal).

citations.claim: Frank Cullen Brophy acquired the historic Babacomari Ranch in 1935
citations.title: Babacomari Ranch History

citations.claim: Family has placed over 2,400 acres under conservation easements
citations.title: Arizona Land and Water Trust - Babacomari Ranch

citations.claim: Family sought county approval for a guest ranch development in 2024
citations.title: County to Consider Permit for New Dude Ranch

neighbors.name: John & Shelley Barnes
neighbors.claims: Cochise County tax lien records list the owner of parcel 106-48-003 as 'Bridget A', not John and Shelley Barnes ([parcelinquirytreasurer.cochise.az.gov](https://parcelinquirytreasurer.cochise.az.gov/Main/TaxLienList)). A Shelley Barnes is a resident of Sierra Vista who has reviewed local electrical services ([leadsmartinc.com](https://leadsmartinc.com/services/electrical-services/electrician/arizona/sierra-vista/antelope-run-electric/)). A John Barnes has served as a contact for the Tucson Amateur Astronomy Association's Chiricahua Astronomy Complex in Cochise County ([tucsonastronomy.org](http://tucsonastronomy.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/TAAA_Newsletter_201103.pdf)). No references in local meetings or news indicate that individuals by these names have taken a public position on development or energy projects ([www.cochise.az.gov](https://www.cochise.az.gov/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=384#:~:text=subscriptions%2C%20save%20form%20progress%20and,COCHISE%20COUNTY%20BOARD)).
neighbors.influence_justification: No public roles or visibility found for a couple by this name

approach_recommendations.engage: Due to the discrepancy in property records (parcel owned by 'Bridget A'), verify the correct landowner identity before outreach. If John and Shelley Barnes are the correct contacts, approach informally to clarify their connection to the property.

neighbors.verification_notes: The provided PIN (106-48-003) is registered to 'Bridget A' in Cochise County tax records. No joint public record for 'John & Shelley Barnes' was found in the county. Individual matches for 'John Barnes' and 'Shelley Barnes' exist but are not linked.

neighbors.name: Jrl Development Llc
neighbors.claims: JRL Development LLC is an Arizona limited liability company ([biologicaldiversity.org](https://biologicaldiversity.org/programs/public_lands/pdfs/20051114-COVEY-RUN-ADEQUATE.pdf)) registered with the Arizona Corporation Commission ([biologicaldiversity.org](https://biologicaldiversity.org/programs/public_lands/rivers/pdfs/covey-run-PUBLIC-REPORT-20140509.pdf)). The entity is associated with Dave Groberg, listed as a contact with an address in Sierra Vista, AZ ([biologicaldiversity.org](https://biologicaldiversity.org/programs/public_lands/pdfs/20051114-COVEY-RUN-ADEQUATE.pdf)). JRL Development LLC has historically operated as a developer in Cochise County, specifically identified as the developer for the "Covey Run" subdivision ([biologicaldiversity.org](https://biologicaldiversity.org/programs/public_lands/rivers/pdfs/covey-run-PUBLIC-REPORT-20140509.pdf)). The entity owns parcels in the local area (Section 31 T20S R20E) which have been subject to water right adjudications ([superiorcourt.maricopa.gov](http://www.superiorcourt.maricopa.gov/SuperiorCourt/GeneralStreamAdjudication/docs/0245ord061219.pdf)). While the draft noted a lack of local presence, public records confirm the entity has a local Sierra Vista contact and a history of residential development in the county ([biologicaldiversity.org](https://biologicaldiversity.org/programs/public_lands/pdfs/20051114-COVEY-RUN-ADEQUATE.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Established local developer history (Covey Run subdivision); local contact (Dave Groberg) implies potential industry connections.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Dave Groberg at the Sierra Vista address. As a developer, they may be open to land transactions or partnership opportunities rather than purely residential concerns.

citations.claim: JRL Development LLC is an Arizona limited liability company
citations.title: Adequate Water Supply Report

citations.claim: registered with the Arizona Corporation Commission
citations.title: Covey Run Public Report

neighbors.name: 381 W Railroad Dr Llc
neighbors.claims: 381 W Railroad Dr LLC holds a 4.21-acre residential property at 381 W Railroad Drive, Huachuca City, which includes a home built in 2011 ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/381-W-Railroad-Dr-Huachuca-City-AZ-85616/109585217_zpid/)). The property has been advertised for rent ($650/month), indicating investment use ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/381-W-Railroad-Dr-Huachuca-City-AZ-85616/109585217_zpid/)). Rental listings for the property direct inquiries to Rena or Lane Mountjoy ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/2150-N-Coronado-Frontage-Rd-Huachuca-City-AZ-85616/300062940_zpid/)). Lane Mountjoy is associated with ABM Development LLC, a general contracting and excavation business based in Huachuca City ([www.abmdevelopment.com](https://www.abmdevelopment.com/)). This connection suggests the entity is managed by local construction/development professionals rather than an absentee investor.
neighbors.influence_justification: Single rental property owner, though connected to local contracting business (ABM Development).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via the Mountjoy family/ABM Development contacts. As local contractors, they may have specific technical questions about construction impacts or potential business interest in the project.

neighbors.name: Cormell Family Trust
neighbors.claims: The Cormell Family Trust holds land in Cochise County, with water rights filings associated with the family name ([www.azwater.gov](https://www.azwater.gov/sites/default/files/adjudications_documents/2017%2001-27%20CombinedDemonstrationProjectReport.pdf)). The trust is likely linked to the family of Leland Thomas Cormell (1933-2014), a long-time resident who served at Fort Huachuca and taught in local schools including Buena High School and Palominas Elementary ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/funeral-homes/obituaries/name/leland-cormell-obituary?pid=171728510&v=batesville)). The family has deep roots in the area, with history dating back to the 1950s ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/funeral-homes/obituaries/name/leland-cormell-obituary?pid=171728510&v=batesville)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Long-time local family with historical ties to education and military sectors; likely holds informal respect but no current high-profile political role found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a multi-generational local family. Acknowledge their long tenure in the area (since 1950s) and focus on how the project respects local character.

neighbors.name: Huachuca City City Of
neighbors.claims: The Town of Huachuca City owns this parcel. The Town's General Plan explicitly identifies renewable energy as a potential future land use, stating that reclaimed landfill parcels could be used for "green energy sources such as a solar panel array" ([www.huachucacityaz.gov](https://www.huachucacityaz.gov/Documents/PublicDownloads/Huachuca%20City%20General%20Plan-05152017.pdf)). Additionally, the Town has pursued solar improvements for community facilities, such as a solar cover for the municipal pool ([huachucacityaz.gov](https://huachucacityaz.gov/community-development-block-grant-cdbg/)). The municipality has also updated tax codes to include specific provisions for solar photovoltaic energy generating systems ([azdor.gov](https://azdor.gov/business/transaction-privilege-tax/model-city-tax-code/rate-and-code-updates)). These documents indicate a supportive policy framework for renewable energy development within the town's jurisdiction.
neighbors.influence_justification: Municipal authority with regulatory control over zoning, permits, and tax codes; General Plan explicitly supports solar land use.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate directly with Town Council and Manager. Reference the General Plan's vision for solar arrays on town land as a basis for alignment. Highlight potential revenue streams and infrastructure improvements.

citations.claim: reclaimed landfill parcels could be used for "green energy sources such as a solar panel array"
citations.title: Huachuca City General Development Plan Update 2017

citations.claim: Town has pursued solar improvements for community facilities, such as a solar cover for the municipal pool
citations.title: Community Development Block Grant Public Hearing Notice

citations.claim: updated tax codes to include specific provisions for solar photovoltaic energy generating systems
citations.title: Model City Tax Code Updates

neighbors.claims: Military Brothers Moving LLC is a moving services company based in Sierra Vista and Huachuca City, founded in 2014 by brothers and military veterans Kevin and Bryan Hoey ([Military Brothers Moving](https://www.militarybrothersmoving.com/)). Business records list the LLC's members as Bryan P. Hoey, Kevin M. Hoey, and Jeffrey T. Hoey ([Better Business Bureau](https://www.bbb.org/us/az/yuma/profile/moving-companies/military-brothers-moving-llc-1126-1000055746)). The company actively engages in local community support, co-creating the 'Tips for Vets' fundraising initiative to benefit the Warrior Healing Center ([Tips4Vet](https://tips4vet.com/)). There is no public record of the company taking a stance on land use disputes or renewable energy development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Local business with positive community engagement through veteran charities, but no evidence of political weight regarding land use.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage owners Kevin and Bryan Hoey; acknowledge their community work with the Warrior Healing Center to build rapport.

neighbors.name: Babacomari Ranch Company
neighbors.claims: Babacomari Ranch Company is a family-owned enterprise managing the historic Babacomari Ranch, which Frank C. Brophy acquired in 1935 ([alwt.org](https://alwt.org/babacomari-ranch/)). The ranch boundaries follow the original 1832 land grant, and the Brophy family has held stewardship for generations ([babacomariranch.com](https://babacomariranch.com/)). The entity recently applied for and secured a Conditional Use Permit to develop a $40â€“60 million guest ranch resort on 2,200 acres of the property, known as the Encino Pasture ([patagoniaregionaltimes.org](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/new-40-60-million-dude-ranch-gets-first-permit/)). Family representatives stated the development is intended to provide a revenue stream to keep the ranch intact, noting that some parts of the ranch had previously been sold to satisfy family members seeking liquidity ([patagoniaregionaltimes.org](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/new-40-60-million-dude-ranch-gets-first-permit/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: The entity controls the largest contiguous private land parcel in Arizona (28,000 acres) and is actively engaged in major land-use developments and conservation partnerships.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with the Brophy family leadership regarding their long-term land management goals. Acknowledge their recent resort development permit and frame any potential collaboration as complementary to their stated goal of keeping the ranch intact and economically sustainable.

citations.claim: Frank C. Brophy acquired the ranch in 1935
citations.title: Babacomari Ranch - Arizona Land and Water Trust

citations.claim: Ranch boundaries follow the original 1832 land grant
citations.title: Babacomari Ranch Home Page

citations.claim: Secured permit for $40â€“60 million guest ranch on 2,200 acres
citations.title: New $40-60 Million Dude Ranch Gets First Permit

citations.claim: Development intended to provide revenue and prevent ranch fragmentation
citations.title: New $40-60 Million Dude Ranch Gets First Permit

neighbors.name: San Ignacio Investments LLC
neighbors.claims: San Ignacio Investments LLC is listed as an entity with property interests in the region, though specific beneficial ownership is not publicly disclosed in available records. A solar project named 'Babacomari Solar' (160 MW) is planned for Cochise County with an expected online date of 2026 ([tep.com](https://www.tep.com/news/teps-largest-battery-system-to-support-customers-through-summer-heat/)). While the project shares the 'Babacomari' name, a direct property link between San Ignacio Investments LLC and the solar developer ClÄ“nera (or its subsidiary Babacomari Solar North LLC) could not be verified in the available public snippets. The solar project entity, Babacomari Solar North LLC, has recently acquired equipment for the project ([pv-magazine-india.com](https://www.pv-magazine-india.com/2025/09/19/meyer-burger-gives-up-on-selling-itself-as-a-whole-sells-u-s-solar-production-tools/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Lack of public profile or verifiable community engagement activity in available records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Verify property ownership and specific relationship to the Babacomari Solar project before formal engagement. Treat as a potential investment vehicle.

neighbors.name: Babacomari Ranch Company LLLP
neighbors.claims: Babacomari Ranch Company LLLP is a limited liability limited partnership associated with the Brophy family, holding title to significant portions of the Babacomari Ranch ([superiorcourt.maricopa.gov](https://www.superiorcourt.maricopa.gov/SuperiorCourt/GeneralStreamAdjudication/docs/schade-sp605ord030112.pdf)). The entity has been an active intervenor in local water rights adjudications, including the San Pedro River Watershed cases ([superiorcourt.maricopa.gov](https://www.superiorcourt.maricopa.gov/SuperiorCourt/GeneralStreamAdjudication/docs/schade-sp605ord030112.pdf)). The ranch has placed over 6,000 acres under conservation easements with the Arizona Land and Water Trust to protect landscape and wildlife corridors ([alwt.org](https://alwt.org/babacomari-ranch/)). Facing economic pressures, the family has pursued development permits for a guest ranch to generate revenue while maintaining the property's integrity ([patagoniaregionaltimes.org](https://patagoniaregionaltimes.org/new-40-60-million-dude-ranch-gets-first-permit/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major landowner with documented legal involvement in regional water rights and conservation efforts.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a sophisticated stakeholder with significant legal and environmental interests. Highlight alignment with their conservation easements and water resource management goals.

citations.claim: Babacomari Ranch Company LLLP is a limited liability limited partnership intervening in water rights cases
citations.title: Order Granting Motions to Intervene - In re General Adjudication of Gila River System

citations.claim: Placed over 6,000 acres under conservation easements
citations.title: Babacomari Ranch - Arizona Land and Water Trust

citations.claim: Pursued development permits for a guest ranch to generate revenue
citations.title: New $40-60 Million Dude Ranch Gets First Permit

overview_summary: Screening of 22 neighbors within 0.5 miles identified 12 residents and 10 organizations, with one neighbor expressing support and 21 maintaining an unknown stance. The area features four high-influence entities, most notably the Brophy familyâ€™s Babacomari Ranch, which maintains a strong local presence focused on land stewardship and selective development. Other key stakeholders include Huachuca City and San Ignacio Investments LLC, while the remaining 18 medium- and low-influence neighbors consist primarily of private trusts and small local businesses.
